raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "Multiple endocrine neoplasia (MEN) 2A", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "The patient presents with symptoms of pheochromocytoma (headache, palpitations, diaphoresis, hypertension, elevated urinary VMA/metanephrines), medullary thyroid carcinoma (diffuse thyroid swelling, elevated calcitonin), and hyperparathyroidism (bone pain, elevated parathormone, hypercalcemia). This triad is characteristic of MEN 2A. MEN 2B would include mucosal neuromas and marfanoid habitus, which are not described. Von Hippel-Lindau syndrome and neurofibromatosis do not present with this combination of findings."}
